meanings.definition: To bake (something) too long or at too high a temperature, causing it to become dry or burnt.
meanings.sent1: I accidentally overbake the cookies, making them hard and inedible.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to overbake the cake, or it will turn out tough and unpleasant.
meanings.sent3: When I overbake my muffins, they end up as hockey pucks instead of a delicious treat.
meanings.sent4: Her tendency to overbake everything turned her kitchen into a burnt battleground.
meanings.sent5: The smell of overbaked bread filled the house, reminding me of my kitchen mishap.

meanings.definition: To be baked too long or at too high a temperature, resulting in a dry or burnt texture.
meanings.sent1: The pie crust will overbake if left in the oven for too long.
meanings.sent2: If you overbake the bread, it will lose its softness and taste burnt.
meanings.sent3: The cookies were so overbaked that they could be used as coasters.
meanings.sent4: The sun overbaked the desert sand, turning it into a scorching hot surface.
meanings.sent5: The overbaked pizza had a blackened crust that no one wanted to eat.
